flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
I give handmade flipbooks as gifts to friends and families. They use a snippet of 6 to 9 seconds of video that I shoot and format for cutting to size.

I try to shoot for a stack of 90 photos per flipbook. At 30 frames per second, 6 seconds gives me 180 frames that print and split into even/odd stacks - this allows me to make two flipbooks of 90 photos each.

Equipment required includes a digital video camera (widescreen/HD support works best) and a few specialized applications that I'll explain in the project.

The original idea for my flipbooks came from The Curious Blog - my flipbooks are a bit wider and I use a different method for creating the frames.
